title: Rengar Shouldn't Be Able to Jump from Bush While Silenced
body:
^Title  

I know what you are thinking "THATS STUPID!" but hear me out before down voting (even though im pretty sure you already did). So my problem with Rengar is his ability to jump on you from really far away and kill you in under a second. That's cool and all because he be an assassin but there is very little counter play since by the time you hit any sort of button to protect yourself, you are already dead. Again he is an assassin so this is normal, the only issue is the other assassins can be stopped by a silence. If you nail the silence BEFORE they jump on you then you done good, but if you fail you are dead, and rightly so. Rengar is hella diffent, cuz the fool can still gap close onto you even while silenced and since his AA's do a bazillion damage you are still dead before you can react. When your only form of CC is a silence (i will explain the scenario shortly) you can't stop him from killing you despite the outplays and skill. So i figure hey a silence should be able to prevent him from leaping at you...  

Now for the scenario that brought this subject up: I was Malzahar (make sense now?) and i had just killed 2 people, one of which with my ult. Then here comes this Rengar and i know i can kill him as long as he doesnt kill me before i put on my E and Ignite. Well here he comes chasing me and im waiting for E to come off CD so i flash and start running. I nail him with my silence taking out a third of his life (he had no MR and i was fed) so for sure my E and Ignite plus Voidy should kill him, i throw down my W on me, turn around and hit E on him but right when i do he jumps and instantly erased me. He erased me so fast my E didnt even go off on him despite the fact i hit it before he jumped.  

So how is that fair? My skills required much more skill, timing, and placement and yet i still lost. My Q is not overly hard to land but it is harder to land on a moving target that is about to leap on your face than just left clicking on an enemy and instantly jumping on them. The Rengar absolutely did not deserve the kill, i definitely played the situation better by hitting him with my Q and readying my W below me where he would surely land.  

Just to be clear i am not mad i was erased so quickly, im not mad my E didnt go off, im not mad Voidy stood there like an idiot. I am mad because i played correctly and did the only thing i could (malz only has a Silence) and timed my abilities correctly but i was defeated merely by kit design. If that was any other assassin, my Q would have won me that fight or allowed me to escape at the very least. I know not all Silences are as hard to hit as Malz's and his isnt even all that hard, but they at least take a bit more skill to properly place and time then Rengar's jump.  

**EDIT**: So somehow ive been misunderstood... IM NOT ASKING TO CHANGE SILENCES TO EFFECT ALL PASSIVES! Only Rengars... why would i want it to effect everything? That is stupid. It stopping Rengar is not stupid, in the situation above i was left with no option but to die despite me being mechanically better. That to me is not a fair situation.

If you really want to counter play the Rengar and you were as fed as you say you were, instead of buying more damage, get something defensive...something to keep you from being so squishy, especially on the immobile Malzahar.  Rengars strength is in one shorting squishies...if you take that away, there's your counterplay

Its really not like that at all but ok  

Yes i will start to buy defensively in the middle of a battle far away from the shop... thanks for the sage advice because you were totally there... I hadnt built my damage yet, all i had was Rylais' which is defensive mind you, and Liandry's which also gives a decent amount of life, i really didnt have my major damage items. Zhonya's is not a bad choice normally but i was in bot lane against a Kog and Thresh so its not really optimal as i dont want to be standing in one place for thresh to grab me, although every time he did i took out 90% of Kogs life. At this point where Reng killed me i didnt have many items and im not complaining that i died which everyone seems to think. I am complaining about a lack of counterplay for certain champions. Im merely pointing out that Rengar can only be stopped by hard CC, so a champion like Malz or Raka have no way of peeling or out playing him.

You say no one is reading your post correctly, but I'm pretty sure everyone is, 

The short answer, no. It makes literally no sense. Silence prevent the usage of abilities, not passives, if you want that to happen, you'd be asking to change every passive as well, not just Rengar, it makes no sense to make literally one arbitrary change just for one champion, no matter how strong the champion is.

Because you're asking for a change that is bad for the game's clarity. If you know that Rengar's jump is just an AA modifier then you'd understand why your request doesn't make sense. It'd be the same as if silences stopped Kalista's hopping. From the wiki:

**Silence:** A unit that is silenced cannot cast abilities or activate items for the duration.

Mobility like Rengar's and Kalista's is not a cast ability.

In regards to your original post - You talk about it being unfair that you had no tools left to disable Rengar **after you had already used your hard CC to kill someone else**. You **did** have a tool to stop Rengar but chose to use it on someone else. Of course a glass cannon assassin is going to be able to blow up a squishy immobile mage if you don't save CC for him.

Edit: Someone already said this, and you still don't get it.



The thing is, his passive jump isn't even a spell, it's more like an AA enhancement. 

And nobody is reading what you said wrong, we're all just taking it as you said and we're just saying we think you're wrong and this is a poor idea.

If you do, it's bad game design. For it to be healthy for the game as a whole, you would have to apply it to all passives.

No. Silences specifically work by preventing any summoner spell or ability usage. If Swain is silenced while in R form he is stuck in R form until the silence wears off (or he runs out of mana). Your suggestion would require an entire re-writing of silences that would make them literally on of the best soft CCs in the game then (silence an adc, now they don't have their steroids. Silence a fighter, now they dont have their passives or abilities. etc.). Additionally, that makes a soft CC that is somewhat rare hard counter multiple champions in an unintuitive and powerful way (silence Anivia, now she doesn't have her egg WHICH SHE LOSES ALL RESISTANCES AND BASE HEALTH TO HAVE EXIST. Silence Ashe/Kalista, suddenly you have a literally useless marksman for however long they are silenced. Silence Tryndamere, guess he can't crit or have the AD from Q now!). You also can't make it work specifically on one champion only as that gives a MASSIVE burden of knowledge on any player and sets precedent for such unintuitive and backwards changes.

here's the counter play as someone who has A LOT of rengar games played.
1. If you know there's a rengar, why are you going near bushes when he can kill you?
2. If he's going full damage he's squishy, stick next to someone with cc (or use your own). In your case you should have waited until he'd jumped out of the bush to flash, once he has no bush to jump from his ult is the only way for him to gap close.
3. His ult not only gives an exclamation point, but makes a very unique noise when he's nearby during it, buy a pink, or upgrade a red trinket and you can see him coming. 
4. Grouping is rengar's biggest weakness, he can't pick off a target with 4 other champions nearby without sentencing himself to death and chancing him getting nothing out of it.
